text: Yes and no : default docker compose method only exposes wallet and CNS ui to localhost http/80. But if you want to use them, you either have to do some dirty tunneling thing, or better, add your own authentification and https to http layer

text: Your nginx docker image running only exposes 80 on localhost. So firewall won't do anything. It's up to you to deploy something by yourself that would expose your wallet to 443/https with a certificate of your choice and basic authentification for example

text:
Hello,

I had a quick question regarding the cadence of whitelist approvals:

From the moment a new IP is submitted, is there a typical turnaround time or expected timeline for when it's approved and adopted by the SVs?

elements.text:
Hello,

I had a quick question regarding the cadence of whitelist approvals:

From the moment a new IP is submitted, is there a typical turnaround time or expected timeline for when it's approved and adopted by the SVs?

text: Around 7 days

elements.text: Around 7 days

text: Thanks Alex, if there's been an IP submitted 7 days ago and still no approval it's normal to just wait another day or so until approval is granted is that correct then?

elements.text: Thanks Alex, if there's been an IP submitted 7 days ago and still no approval it's normal to just wait another day or so until approval is granted is that correct then?

text: For us it took around 2 weeks to be whitelisted by every party

elements.text: For us it took around 2 weeks to be whitelisted by every party

text: Although IIRC you only need to be whitelisted by 2/3rds of the SVs to get connected?

elements.text: Although IIRC you only need to be whitelisted by 2/3rds of the SVs to get connected?

text: Done
